reviewText: The sequel to Critters, Critters 2:The Main Course is a little worse than the original. This time the film becomes more of a comedy than anything else ie. at this stage we now realise that the Critter quartet series is an entire spoof on other horror material.  In fact Critters 2 earned it it's most prolific (if you can call it that) scene with the man dressed up in an Easter Bunny suit.  I'll say no more!  Still quite watchable on a boring Sunday evening.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'll have to admit.  Critters 2: The Main Course does have more action in it, just not as very good as the original.  Still it leaves off where the first Critters ended.  I liked it just as good as the first Critters movie.

reviewText: If you enjoyed the first you should devour this one.Enter even more comedy, popcorn fun, a little more gore/violence, and a playboy type nude woman walking around with a big gun strapped to her side -- yes ladies and gentlemen, it's Critters 2....The Main Course.This time its more focused on the town than on one singular family. The local nosy newspaper reporter (she worked in the jail in the first), the renegade and rebellious sheriff (from part one at the end), the troublemaking teenage bully, the girl next door, farmers, and critter appetizers.Brad's back in town to see his grandmother (why he'd want to go back to that town at all is beyond me) he's a teenager now and not some little kid like the first. His hair is redder, his personality is pretty goofy, and he keeps trying to make a move on Megan Morgan, which is the countriest name I have heard in years of horror movie past.The grandmother's a funny old woman who abhors red meat, chocolate, and anything unhealthy. We see her offering carob (as in the candy substitute) in the movie, and smelling Brads breath for the offending red chow. Of course Brad isnt' accepted by most of the town when he returns due to his previous Critter encounter. The sheriff from the first has been voted out and replaced with a thinner, younger, and dark haired sheriff who meets an unfortunite end in a bunny costume!The critter eggs are large and of course wierd colored, with a sort of leathery texture. Pretty nasty things when they're stepped on. This is critter yolk folks -- it ain't yellow.A man who enjoys selling egges (WTF??) is unfortunite enough to obtain some of these particular eggs and sells them to Brads grandmother, who brings them painted to the annual Church easter picking. I guess the grandmother gives away painted easter eggs that AREN'T boiled first, but anyway...No matter. The critters hatch and spread around town chomping on the neighbors -including a dog - and even form the famous critter ball :) The special effects in some parts of cheesy but they're humurous. The critters (once hatched, of course) are the same as the first but when they go on a rolling critter chase down, it sounds like a freaking cattle stampede! They even speak more and are lured by false hamburger meat bait, which is pretty fun to uphold.Besides the quirky townfolk we have the off belt settings. Such as the diner which keeps playing the hysterical Hungry Heifer song. It may as well be called the movie's motto. It's there from the beginning and is relevant at the end. It's an intentionally annoying tune but one so comical I smile everytime I hear it and to my dismay start humming right along.The bounty hunters return (enter the nude woman) and they bring Charley back with them. (ugh) Again we have the big guns and the cool space gadgets but they're not as big a role as the first, due to a circumstances I won't spoil, and this time it's left more up to the humans.The ending was more fun than the originals. The town gets together as a team (sort of) with traps, weapons and what not - many goofy stumps but the critters are the main stars we keep our eyes on.I know some fans of the first didn't care for this one as much (or at all) -- perhaps because the humor is enhanced -- but I still found it cute, entertaining, and as fun as the first one with a little small differences in theme.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I grew up watching the critters franchise and I just had the urge to watch Critters 2 since Critters 2 was that one movie that I didn't see enough because it was mostly hard to find as well. I have seen Critters 1,3,and 4 too many times but Critters 2 has a soft cheesy place in my heart because there is alot of funny scenes in this movie especially the ridiculous easter bunny costume scene which made me laugh like crazy when I was a kid. I used to rewind that scene multiple times since I thought it was the funniest thing in the world. Anyways, this movie should only be seen by Critters fans and no one else because anyone else that haven't seen Critters would just not understand the humor and sillyness of this movie.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Critters 2 picks up where the other one leaves off in Grovers Bend, Kansas. The eggs left behind are placed too close to a heater and a Children's Day Care. The alien bounty hunters return as does Brad Brown (Scott Grimes) the teen hero in the first film. Brad develops a love interest in a teen reporter (Liane Curtis) a "Jimmy Olsen with breasts."With the characters established, this film moves quickly into the action which provides us with more camp than the first feature. The Critters are less hidden from the camera in this feature. I enjoyed the sequel more than the original. Nothing like a little girl on a tricycle being chased by Critters.Parental Guide: No f-bombs or sex. Nudity (Cynthia Garris)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Critters 2 is one of my all time favorite movies! Its even better than the first! they just don't make them like they used to! I was a bit suprised that this movie had nudity in it! and on the back of the case it said PG-13 but on the VHS it said PG. but anyways if you haven't seen this movie get off of the computer and go but it! Good luck finding it! i've seen the 1st one and borders on DVD and i bought the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th on VHS at hastings, and found the 1st one at Shopko on VHS for only $3.00! Oh and don't miss out on the critters subtitles! the one where the critter gets his hair blown off is so funny!
